#summary Instructions for registering the YaniBpelExtension in WSO2 BPS

= Introduction =

This document aims to provide a basic description of how what steps need to be performed in order to register and activate the YaniBpelExtension for use in WSO2 BPS.


= Details =
1. Copy the YaniBpelExtension.jar file to the following directory <wso2_install_dir>\repository\components\lib
2. Open the bps.xml file in the following directory <wso2_install_dir>\repository\conf
3. Register the YaniBpelExtension in the bps.xml file by updating the <tns:ExtensionBundles> element
Your updated element would look like:
<!-- BPEL Extensions -->
    <tns:ExtensionBundles>
        <tns:runtimes>
            <tns:runtime class="bg.unisofia.fmi.dwsc.bpel.extension.YaniWsComposerBundle"/>
        </tns:runtimes>
        <!--<tns:filters>
            <tns:filter class="org.wso2.bps.SampleCorrelationFilter"/>
        </tns:filters>-->
    </tns:ExtensionBundles>
